intro: Malvastrum tridactylites var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth thornapple, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with three to five deep divisions, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds.
